intro: Ghinia verbenacea, commonly known as the common vervain, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, wastelands, and along roadsides. Ghinia verbenacea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
